articles.title: Congratulations to 15th King of Malaysia
articles.content:
Congratulations to 15th King of Malaysia
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Sultan Muhammad V upon his assumption of the throne as the 15th king of Malaysia. 
					 The message wished the king and people of Malaysia success in their work for the development and prosperity of the country and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets PM of Lebanon
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets PM of Lebanon
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Saad Hariri on his appointment as prime minister of Lebanon.
					 The message expressed the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing him success in his work for the country's stability and prosperity.

articles.title: Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
articles.content:
Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, on Dec. 5 received a reply message from Bounnang Vorachith, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
					 The president in his reply message expressed sincere thanks to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, the government and people of the Lao People's Democratic Republic and on his own behalf for sending warm congratulations and the best wishes to the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, the government and people of the Lao People's Democratic Republic (LPDR) and him on the occasion of the 41st founding anniversary of the LPDR.
					
					 The message expressed the belief that the traditional and good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow strong in conformity with the wishes of the peoples of the two countries so as to bring substantial benefits to the peoples of the two countries and make contributions to ensuring peace in the region and the world and boosting the relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 The message wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and bigger successes in his noble work.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Reply Message from Thai King
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Reply Message from Thai King
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, on Friday received a reply message from Maha Vajiralongkorn, king of Thailand.
					 The king in the message expressed thanks to Kim Jong Un for having sent a congratulatory message to him on accession to the throne as king of Thailand.
					
					 He heartily wished good health and happiness to Kim Jong Un and well-being and prosperity to the DPRK and its people.

articles.title: 2016 Report on Human Rights Abuses in S. Korea Released
articles.content:
2016 Report on Human Rights Abuses in S. Korea Released
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Measure Council for Human Rights in South Korea released the 2016 report on human rights abuses in south Korea Friday to disclose the worst ten of many crimes committed by the south Korean Park Geun Hye regime of traitors in 2016.
					 Dealing with the thrice-cursed group abduction by the regime, the report says:
					
					 The regime perpetrated an unheard-of high-profile crime by abducting a group of more than 10 women citizens of the DPRK working abroad to south Korea on April 5.
					
					 Not content with it, the puppet authorities conducted a cruel and hideous "operation to pressurize them to defect".
					
					 Censuring the regime's moves to deploy "THAAD" only to destroy the cradle of south Koreans, the report goes on:
					
					 THAAD, a U.S. lethal weapon for a nuclear war, is termed a "weapon system with critical defects" even within the U.S. military for transmitting strong electromagnetic waves and generating deafening engine noise that hugely affect not only human lives but also the environment.
					
					 Detailing the hideous human rights abuses in south Korea that plunged its people's living into destitution, the report notes:
					
					 The Park regime's irregularities and corruption and incompetence crippled the economy and deteriorated the already worsening people's living in south Korea this year.
					
					 "State debt" of south Korea hit an all-time high of 1.17 trillion U.S. dollars and the number of big businesses on the verge of bankruptcy at present has increased 37 percent over that in 2012.
					
					 More than 2 000 minor businesses involved in the production of goods for export went bankrupt one after another. This spilled over into the whole manufacturing sector, causing at least 90 000 manufacturing companies to go bankrupt.
					
					 The number of the unemployed has reached more than 4.5 million or a 23.3 percent increase, compared with that three years ago. The number of the under-unemployed reached 10 million and the young jobless rate hit an all-time high of 34. 2 percent.
					
					 The Park regime wantonly infringed upon the vital rights of many businessmen and workers of south Korea by totally shutting down the Kaesong Industrial Park overnight.
					
					 The report refers to the murder of peasant Paek Nam Gi caused by fascist violence and to the disaster caused by damper germicide that gave rise to the horror of death.
					
					 The damper germicide-related disaster was caused as foreign multinational businesses and puppet conglomerates put on massive sale germicide containing toxic chemicals under the pretext of killing germs in the room air, thus causing huge casualties, it notes, adding:
					
					 The number of direct victims of damper germicide from January to August this year stood at 3 204 and the number of deaths showed a drastic increase to 693. The potential victims are estimated to be 290 000 at least and 2.27 million at most.
					
					 The report also reveals a "blacklist" denounced as modern-day version of "burning books on the classics and burying Confucian scholars alive".
					
					 Hankook Ilbo of south Korea on Oct. 12 reported that Chongwadae worked out the "blacklist" in the field of art and literature and sent it to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism and organizations under it.
					
					 The "blacklist" reportedly contain the names of persons of culture who either signed a declaration demanding the abrogation of the "government's enforcement ordinance" related to the special law on the ferry Sewol disaster or supported a declaration on the situation over the disaster and of those who voted for candidates from opposition parties and independent candidates during the "presidential" election and Seoul mayoral election, 9 473 in all.
					
					 The report identifies uninterrupted child abuses in south Korea and human rights abuses within its puppet army and censures the Park Geun Hye group of traitors for their moves to nullify of the crimes related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 The criminal acts of the Park Geun Hye group which rubbed salt into the wounds of the victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and insulted the dignity and self-respect of the nation are thrice-cursed crimes tantamount to those committed by the "five traitors of 1905" who sold off the country to the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Blasting the detestable farce for "bill on human rights in the north" staged by the human rights abusers, the document says that even though the Park group of traitors are working hard to tarnish the image of the DPRK by use of the worn-out bill, it will only disclose their human rights abuses.
					
					 The report stresses that the hideous human rights abuses committed by the south Korean puppet group in 2016 would be recorded as the most cursed crimes in history.

articles.title: Participants in 1st Conference of Chairpersons of Primary Committees of WPK Watch Korean Documentary Film
articles.content:
Participants in 1st Conference of Chairpersons of Primary Committees of WPK Watch Korean Documentary Film
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 1st Conference of Chairpersons of the Primary Committees of the Workers' Party of Korea Thursday watched the Korean documentary film "Ushering in Golden Age of Revolution".
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, vice-chairmen of the Central Committee of the WPK, Jo Yon Jun, first vice department director of the Central Committee of the WPK, officials of the Central Committee of the WPK together with the participants in the conference.
					
					 The film impressively represented the exploits supreme leader Kim Jong Un performed in all spheres for the building of a powerful socialist country including politics, military, economy and culture in such a brief span of time by wisely leading the whole Party, entire army and all the people.

articles.title: Participants in First Conference of Chairpersons of Primary Committees of WPK Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants in First Conference of Chairpersons of Primary Committees of WPK Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The participants in the First Conference of Chairpersons of the Primary Committees of the Workers' Party of Korea visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They placed wreaths and bunches of flowers before the graves of Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik, and the graves of Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok and paid silent tribute to them.
					
					 After visiting the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum, they looked round the historical mementoes displayed at the old home, looking back upon the revolutionary career of the President.
					
					 They also visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong.
					
					 They placed bunches of flowers before the bust of anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk and paid tribute to her.
					
					 Visiting the Youth Movement Museum, they looked back upon the feats performed by the peerlessly great men who hewed the Korean youth movement and opened the history of the building of youth power.
					
					 They went round the National Gifts Exhibition House associated with the sincerity of all fellow countrymen holding President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal sun of the nation for all ages.
					
					 At the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site and the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, they grasped the greatness of the brilliant commanders of Mt. Paektu who established ever-victorious traditions in the showdown with the U.S. lasting century after century.
					
					 They also looked round the National House of Class Education.

articles.title: Kangwon Provincial Art Theatre Opens
articles.content:
Kangwon Provincial Art Theatre Opens
 Wonsan, December 23 (KCNA) -- The Kangwon Provincial Art Theatre has been successfully refurbished to open with due ceremony Friday.
					 The art theatre is located at the picturesque seashore to suit the appearance of Wonsan City, a modern port city, and its refurbishing is meant to meet the requirements of a highly civilized socialist nation so as to be able to fully satisfy the evermore increasing cultural demand of the people. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were officials concerned and officials and working people in the city.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, they enjoyed a performance "Song of the Blessed People in Kangwon Province" given by artistes of the Kangwon Provincial Art Troupe.

articles.title: 32nd Festival of Science and Technology Held
articles.content:
32nd Festival of Science and Technology Held
Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The 32nd festival of science and technology of the State Academy of Sciences took place at the Academy on Dec. 20-23.
					 Attending the festival were scientists, technicians and teachers of branches and research institutes of the Academy and the University of Sciences.
					
					 The festival, divided into sector panels, introduced more than 400 achievements.
					
					 The festival witnessed broad introduction of scientific and technical data and proposals and the latest technical goods presented by scientific and research institutes and universities, and exchange of successes and experiences made in the course of developing and introducing them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Registered as Honorary Member of Sucre Foundation of Venezuela
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Registered as Honorary Member of Sucre Foundation of Venezuela
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The Foundation of Investigation for Alcala History and Heritage of Generalissimo A. Antonio Joseph Francisco Sucre of Venezuela registered Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, as its honorary member. 
					 The certificate of honorary member to Kim Jong Un was conveyed to the DPRK ambassador to Venezuela by the president of the foundation with due ceremony on Dec. 16.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were personages and members of the foundation, the United Left Party, the Military University, the Foreign Ministry and other units of Venezuela and the DPRK ambassador to Venezuela and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The president of the foundation said:
					
					 Each country should have strength enough to defend itself.
					
					 In the DPRK socialism has been firmly protected thanks to the strong military muscle provided by the preceding leaders and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It is our great pleasure and honor to present the certificate of honorary member to Kim Jong Un who is leading the struggle to defend the sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					 Jose Gonzalez Alcala Morales, coordinator of Department of Military Idea of Hugo Chavez of Military University, said the world people know well the outstanding strategy, courage and commanding art of Kim Jong Un. The DPRK will win victory only as it is led by him who loves the people and consolidates the single-minded unity in every way, he added.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Sucre Foundation of Venezuela
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Sucre Foundation of Venezuela
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the Foundation of Investigation for Alcala History and Heritage of Generalissimo A. Antonio Joseph Francisco Sucre of Venezuela on the occasion of the fifth anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 Jose Gonzalez Alcala Morales, coordinator of the Department of Military Idea of Hugo Chavez of Military University of Venezuela, handed the gift over to the DPRK ambassador to the country on Dec. 19.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 Roman O. Jimenez Ortega, military attache of the Cuban Embassy who is doyen of the corps, handed over the floral basket and congratulatory letter to Army General Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, Friday.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Mourners' Delegation of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Mourners' Delegation of Koreans in Japan
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Thursday received a letter from the members of the mourners' delegation of Koreans in Japan who visited the socialist homeland to commemorate the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The letter said Marshal Kim Jong Un invited the mourners' delegation of Koreans in Japan on the greatest mourning day of the nation and let them pay tribute to the fatherly leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Noting that they keenly felt what a great man the Korean people upheld as their leader and father through the national memorial service and other events in the presence of Marshal Kim Jong Un, the letter went on:
					
					 The past five years when we had boundless honor and fortune of holding you, identical to leader Kim Jong Il in idea, leadership ability and virtues, as supreme leader of the cause of Juche were the days we deeply felt that the Korean nation is blessed with illustrious leaders, great suns and commanders down through generations.
					
					 The respected Marshal has sent congratulatory messages and letters and important instructions every year to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) to meticulously guide the struggle of its officials and other Koreans in Japan for opening up a new heyday of the movement of Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Thanks to the respected Marshal, Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea will be prosperous as the country of the great sun for all ages.
					
					 The letter expressed the will of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan to fully discharge their mission for the nation in the worthwhile struggle to build a reunified and prosperous powerful Paektusan nation in Korea.

articles.title: Brilliant Successes Made in DPRK in 2016
articles.content:
Brilliant Successes Made in DPRK in 2016
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- In the year of 2016, the Korean people achieved great successes in the building of a socialist power by launching a dynamic offensive with the spirit of self-development-first from the beginning of the year. 
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year address for Juche 105 (2016) said that the principle of giving priority to self-development should be maintained.
					
					 He also said that self-development alone is the road to sustaining the dignity of our country and our nation and to paving a broad avenue for the revolution and construction.
					
					 With affection, trust, dignity and pride in everything of their own, the Korean people wrought eye-opening miracles in all sectors despite the hostile forces' all sorts of toughest sanctions and blockade and pressure upon the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK succeeded in the first H-bomb test and nuclear warhead explosion test this year when the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea was held and ranked itself among advanced nuclear powers.
					
					 It also successfully launched earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4, 100 percent locally manufactured on the threshold of the Day of the Shining Star (February 16), leader Kim Jong Il's birthday.
					
					 Meanwhile, it made unprecedented achievements one after another in the fields of electric power, coal-mining, metal, machine, light industry, agriculture, construction, scientific research and sports.
					
					 The Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex, manufactured high performance electric locomotives of new type in the self-development spirit in the wake of the production of the first underground train.
					
					 80hp tractors and other modern trucks, buses, cargo ships and solar-powered ferryboats were made in the fields of machine industry and land and marine transport. And Hwanggumhae-class multi-purpose fishing boats were built in the field of fisheries.
					
					 Scientists and technicians manufactured 250kW wind power generator, completed the technology of producing electrode for UHP electric arc furnace and developed the Korean-style mining machinery, electric motors, energy-saving transformers and CNC machines.
					
					 In the period of the 70-day campaign, hundreds of objects were completed and remodeled and went operational. The flood-hit northern parts of North Hamgyong Province were recovered in the 200-day campaign and thousands of industrial establishments overfulfilled their yearly plans.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Great Life for Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Great Life for Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- On the threshold of the birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk (December 24), the Korean people are recollecting with deep emotion the immortal feats she performed for the reunification of the country.
					 Korea's reunification was her greatest desire and noble aim of life and struggle.
					
					 Korea was liberated from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule, but it was compelled to suffer pain of division due to the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 Kim Jong Suk, who valued the destiny of the country and nation before anyone, worked heart and soul for reunifying the country, true to the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 In the spring of Juche 38 (1949), she met women from south Korea who struggled against the U.S. imperialists' colonial fascist rule and moves for national division, true to the President's policy of national reunification. She requested them to take the lead in the struggle for national reunification.
					
					 She also led Ryo Un Hyong and Kim Ku to the road of genuine patriotism and showed loving care for women delegates from south Korea, who participated in the Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Social Organizations in North and South Korea, energetically conducting the work for national unity and reunification.
					
					 That was why a south Korean woman intellectual said in an article that thanks to Kim Jong Suk's warm loving care, not only the people of all social standings in the north but also personages of the south with differing ideology, political view and belief found out the right way of life and became patriotic fighters.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Censures Japan's Impudent Act to Evade Responsibility for Redressing Past Crimes
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Censures Japan's Impudent Act to Evade Responsibility for Redressing Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Japan has become frantic in kicking up an anti-DPRK human rights racket over the "abduction issue".
					 There was a "seminar on human rights" under the sponsorship of the government on the pretext of "rescuing victims abducted by north Korea" in Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture on Dec. 16.
					
					 Three days later, the Japan chief Cabinet secretary announced that the Japanese government would expand from 2017 the band of shortwave radio broadcasting for the Japanese "abducted to north Korea".
					
					 This is an impudent act to conceal the abduction crimes rampant in the Japanese society, sweep under the carpet the hideous abduction and forcible drafting committed by Japan in the past and use the "abduction issue" that had already seen a solution as an excuse for evading its redemption of the past.
					
					 It is the height of impudence for Japan to cite "abduction" to ratchet up the racket for human rights against the DPRK.
					
					 This year alone, several missing persons who had been claimed to have been "abducted" by the north were identified and a month ago another person who had been reported missing the blame for which was placed on the north was found out, making Japan a laughing stock of the world.
					
					 In June a police in Fukui Prefecture clarified that Kazuya Miyauchi (32 at the time of missing) who was claimed to be definitely possible to have been abducted by the north in 1997 was identified in the country and on December 1 the security department of Tokyo Police Agency clarified that Masanori Katsuki, 68, (36 at the time of missing) whose possibility of having been abducted by north Korea was acknowledged to be undeniable after he went missing in Edogawa District, Tokyo Metropolis in February 1985 was identified in the country in the latter half of November this year.
					
					 Japan is the hotbed of abduction and the hideous human rights abuser and a country bereft of elementary qualifications to mention "human rights".
					
					 In the past it forcibly drafted more than 8.4 million young and middle-aged Koreans to force them into medieval sexual slavery or to be cannon fodder and mercilessly killed over one million Koreans.  What's worse, it reduced 200,000 Korean women into sexual slavery, trampling down their youth and chastity.
					
					 Yet, the Japanese reactionaries have the face to describe themselves as "victims of abduction" and assert that "liquidation of past can not be made without solution to the abduction issue".
					
					 Japan has taken the lead in the moves against the DPRK by extending every year the measure for sanctions on the DPRK which it started under the pretext of "abduction issue". It has lent a deaf ear to the international voice calling for the redemption of its unprecedented crimes against humanity in the past and has dodged apology and reparation.
					
					 The aim sought by Japan in touting the "abduction issue" is to divert world attention to the DPRK and sweep under the carpet its own human rights abuses.
					
					 Japan is now going so foolish. The liquidation of the past is not an issue of such nature which may be done or may be evaded.
					
					 The more desperately Japan tries to deny the past crimes and sweep under the carpet the stark history of aggression and plunder committed by it, the more glaringly it will reveal its morally vulgar and brazen-faced nature before the international community.
					
					 Japan had better face up to the trend of the times and stop such a clumsy farce aimed at evading the liquidation of the past.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Bellicose Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Bellicose Remarks under Fire
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- An official of the Foreign Ministry of Japan at a recent meet-the press blustered that Japan might attack the DPRK by exercising "the right to collective self-defense" if south Korea requests in contingency on the Korean peninsula and in case "grave threat" to peace and stability of Japan is confirmed.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Friday observes: This is the unpardonable bellicose remarks made by the political pigmies openly revealing their attempt to reinvade Korea.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 What the Japanese reactionaries uttered is nothing but pretence to cover up their reinvasion scenario.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries seek to hurl the south Korean puppet forces into escalating the confrontation with the DPRK to ignite a war and stage a comeback to Korea under that pretext. 
					
					 They are eagerly waiting for a war to break out on the Korean peninsula through the prolonged evil cycle of inter-Korean confrontation and escalating tension.
					
					 No matter how desperately they may try to justify and legalize their moves for reinvasion, vociferating about fictitious gibberish about "threat", they can never hide their criminal purpose.
					
					 Militarist Japan is seriously miscalculating, obsessed with reinvasion hysteria.
					
					 Gone are days never to return when Japan could occupy other's land and dominate in a gangster-like way and invade other Asian countries as it pleased.
					
					 If Japan recklessly opts for reinvasion like a newborn puppy knowing no fear of a tiger, it will face miserable destruction only.

articles.title: Pro-U.S. Conservative Regime Bound to Collapse: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Pro-U.S. Conservative Regime Bound to Collapse: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Many resistance movements took place in south Korea for several decades in the past against the fascist dictators but never have millions of people turned out in their stubborn actions with candlelight in their hands irrespective of region, age, progressive or conservative tendency, class and strata as now, throwing the conservative ruling forces into a predicament, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 This being a hard reality, traitor Park Geun Hye, confining herself in Chongwadae, is turning a deaf ear to the shouts of the people from all walks of life demanding she step down, and making desperate efforts to prolong her dirty remaining days.
					
					 Her fate is as clear as noonday from the viewpoint of the nature of the present situation and its causes.
					
					 There is no way out for those going against the voices of the people. Whoever goes reckless while prioritizing the partisan ambition and self-interest is bound to go to the grave of history together with the Park Geun Hye group.
					
					 The candlelight revolution dealt telling blows to the Park regime which has committed thrice-cursed crimes while engrossing in acts of treachery and unpopular rule. It will record a new chapter in the movement for radically transforming the south Korean politics.
					
					 This is an undeniable necessity of history. 
					
					 What the people support and follow is justice and victory.
					
					 Those going against the people's mindset and trampling down it are fated to meet a doom.
					
					 This is the immutable truth and solemn lesson left in history by the year 2016 crowded with lots of significant events.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Slams Puppet Diplomats' Corrupt Acts
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Slams Puppet Diplomats' Corrupt Acts
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on Dec. 21 carried an editorial denouncing the puppet diplomats' corrupt acts.
					 A south Korean diplomat working in Chile sexually abused a minor of the country, which is little short of disgracing south Korea, the editorial said.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Demands Resignation of PM
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Demands Resignation of PM
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification staged a demonstration Wednesday in Seoul demanding resignation of the puppet prime minister.
					 That day it released a commentary demanding the prime minister's resignation.
					
					 Accusing him of having played a flagship role in wrongly handling diplomatic and security hot potatoes like deployment of THAAD in south Korea, conclusion of an agreement on protecting military intelligence and "agreement" with Japan on the issue of sexual slavery, the commentary termed him an accomplice in the crimes committed by Park Geun Hye and Choe Sun Sil.

articles.title: S. Korean Trade Unions Confederation Demands Ouster of Chief Executive and Dissolution of Ruling Party
articles.content:
S. Korean Trade Unions Confederation Demands Ouster of Chief Executive and Dissolution of Ruling Party
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally in Seoul demanding immediate resignation of Park Geun Hye and dissolution of the tycoons' body and the "Saenuri Party" Wednesday, according to the south Korean newspaper Nodong and Segye.
					 2,000 odd members took part in the rally.
					
					 Speakers accused tycoons of flatly denying the suspicion of their involvement in the "Park Geun Hye-Choe Sun Sil scandal" at a hearing held at the "National Assembly" only to insult the angry workers and other people.
					
					 As long as the magnates go with impunity, the bi-polarization of society will continue and the exploitative structure of monopolistic capitalism gain more support, they added.
					
					 They demanded detention of the tycoons, repeal of the system of paying salaries according to piece rates and retrogressive revision of labor law, immediate resignation and detention of Park.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Calls for Elimination of Those Engaged in Abusing Power
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Calls for Elimination of Those Engaged in Abusing Power  
Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Core members of the Ulsan Headquarters of the Confederation of Trade Unions of south Korea and its affiliated organization held protest meetings all at once outside the offices of pro-Park lawmakers of the "Saenuri Party" in Ulsan area on Dec. 20, according to the south Korean online paper OhmyNews.
					 The participants said that the citizens are now strongly demanding Park Geun Hye step down and the "Saenuri Party" dissolve itself, adding: 
					
					 Lawmakers of the "Saenuri Party" involved in abusing power should resign from the political circle at once and opt to join in the action for the ouster of Park as demanded by the citizens.

articles.title: Prompt and Fair Investigation into Park Geun Hye Group Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Prompt and Fair Investigation into Park Geun Hye Group Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The Emergency People's Action for Ousting the Park Geun Hye Regime of south Korea at a press conference in Seoul Wednesday demanded a prompt and fair investigation into those involved in the scandal of abusing power, according to the south Korean on-line newspaper Tongil News.
					 A statement was read out at the conference.
					
					 The people's attention is focused on the role of the special prosecution now that the Park clique has denied all illegal acts in her written "answer" submitted to the "constitutional court" and Choe Sun Sil flatly denied her conspiracy with the "president," statement said, adding:
					
					 A prompt and fair investigation should be made into bribery between the "president" and moguls, the abuse of power by Park's former chief of staff of Chongwadae Kim Ki Chun and former chief secretary of civil administration U Pyong U, Park's seven hours' absence in office at the time of the ferry Sewol disaster and Chongwadae's illegal surveillance and red herring operation, etc.
					
					 The Confederation of Trade Unions of south Korea also held a press conference that day, demanding a thorough investigation into Park's scandal.

articles.title: Group of Korean Youths in Japan Stages Anti-Park Geun Hye Struggle
articles.content:
Group of Korean Youths in Japan Stages Anti-Park Geun Hye Struggl
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- A group of Korean youths in Japan on Dec. 20 staged a protest demonstration outside the south Korean embassy in Japan, demanding traitor Park Geun Hye immediately step down from office. 
					 The head of the group read out a protest letter addressed to the puppet embassy.
					
					 The letter said horrible hideous crimes and scandals were disclosed before the world and the motion calling for impeachment was passed. Therefore, the group of traitors should be taken to prison, but they still remain coiled up in Chongwadae, standing against the angered people's torchlight, it pointed out.
					
					 The youth group handed the protest letter over to the puppet embassy.
					
					 Earlier, on Dec. 19, it staged loudspeaker van protests against the puppet embassy and the Central Headquarters of the south Korean Residents Association in Japan on Dec. 19.
					
					 It launched broadcasting service calling for full support to the south Korean people's struggle demanding Park Geun Hye's resignation and participation in the signature campaign of overseas compatriots in different parts of Japan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Hold the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung in High Esteem as the Eternal President of Our Republic" was brought out in booklet by the Khabarovsk Territory Publishing House of Russia on Dec. 13.
					 The work, published on July 11 and 19, Juche 83 (1994), stresses the need to uphold President Kim Il Sung in high esteem for all ages and indicates the tasks for preserving and successfully inheriting and developing his idea and undying exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Finland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Finland
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Hasten the Final Victory through a Revolutionary Ideological Offensive" was brought out in pamphlet by the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 The speech made by Kim Jong Un at the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the Workers' Party of Korea on Feb. 25, Juche 103 (2014) clarifies that the whole course of the Korean revolution can be called a period of ideological work to give the fullest play to the might of the truth of the revolutionary ideas of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It also indicates tasks and ways facing the field of the party ideological work at present.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place in Helsinki on Dec. 14.

articles.title: Cuban Figures Visit DPRK Embassy in Havana
articles.content:
Cuban Figures Visit DPRK Embassy in Havana
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Cuban figures visited the DPRK Embassy in Havana on Dec. 16 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 A vice-president of the Council of State who is a member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba (CPC), Jose Ramon Balaguer, head of the International Department of the C.C., CPC, and a vice foreign minister laid a large floral basket before the picture of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the name of the people, Communist Party and government of Cuba, and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The vice president of the Council of State lauded Kim Jong Il as the great leader of the Korean people who devoted his all to the country and revolution.
					
					 He said:
					
					 Though Comrades Kim Jong Il and Fidel Castro Ruz passed away, their great ideas and exploits will remain forever in the minds of not only the Korean people and Cuban people but also the progressives.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided and developed by the preceding leaders will grow stronger under the deep care of Comrades Kim Jong Un and Raul Castro Ruz.
					
					 I send greetings to the party, government and people of the DPRK who are extending support and solidarity to the struggle of the Cuban people in the international arena.
					
					 The head of the International Department of the C.C., CPC said that the party, government and people of Cuba would invariably support the just cause of the party, government and people of the DPRK in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Indian and French Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Indian and French Figures
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Indian and French figures issued statements on Dec. 16 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 G. Debarajan, secretary of the Central Committee of the All-India Forward Bloc, said in a statement that he was looking back upon the immortal exploits performed by Kim Jong Il in accomplishing the cause of global independence on the threshold of Dec. 17.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il made a great contribution to ensuring peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of the world.
					
					 It is his greatest exploit that he defended socialism from every move for aggression by the imperialists including the U.S.
					
					 Korean socialism serves as a beacon of hope for the progressives standing against the imperialists.
					
					 Guy Dupre, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, said:
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il successfully carried forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He firmly defended socialism and national dignity and made tireless efforts for turning the DPRK into a powerful country.
					
					 He turned the Workers' Party of Korea into the general staff of the Korean revolution and a dignified and powerful party which defends the people's interests and enjoys their absolute support and trust and the Korean People's Army into the invincible revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 Guy Dupre praised Kim Jong Il's exploits for national reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- There took place meetings for remembering leader Kim Jong Il in China, Indonesia, Slovenia and Iceland on Dec. 7 and 16.
					 Mustafa Al Safarini, chairman of the Arab Information Centre in China, said that Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul till the last moments of his life under the motto of believing in the people as in Heaven.
					
					 The chancellor of Bungkarno University of Indonesia said that as Kim Jong Il had so great and noble outlook on the people which only a genuine father of the people can possess, he is alive in the hearts of the Korean people and all other world progressives.
					
					 Igor Jurisic, chairman of the SloveniaÔºçKorea Friendship Association, praised Kim Jong Il for building the country into a powerful socialist state by dint of his original Songun politics, adding that his feats will shine forever with the century.
					
					 Jon Arni Halldorsson, general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society, said that Kim Jong Il's idea and cause are being successfully carried forward by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Participantes en Primera Conferencia ven documental coreano
articles.content:
Participantes en Primera Conferencia ven documental coreano
Pyongyang, 23 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Los participantes en la Primera Conferencia de los Presidentes de Comite de Base de Todo el Partido vieron el dia 22 el documental "Para abrir la era de esplendor de la revolucion".
					Lo vieron junto con ellos Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam y Choe Thae Bok, vicepresidentes del CC del PTC, Jo Yon Jun, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, y los funcionarios del CC del PTC.
					
					El filme demuestra en escenas impresionantes las hazanas del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un quien al dirigir sabiamente a todo el partido, ejercito y pueblo, logro registrar en un periodo tan corto los cambios del siglo en todos los sectores de construccion de potencia socialista, incluyendo la politica, el plano militar, la economia y la cultura.

articles.title: Participantes en Primera Conferencia recorren varios lugares de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Participantes en Primera Conferencia recorren varios lugares de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 23 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Los participantes en la Primera Conferencia de los Presidentes de Comite de Base de Todo el Partido realizaron una visita a Mangyongdae.
					Ellos depositaron las ofrendas y ramos de flores ante las tumbas de Kim Po Hyon y Ri Po Ik y Kim Hyong Jik y Kang Pan Sok y guardaron un momento de silencio.
					
					Recorrieron el Museo de la Historia Revolucionaria de Mangyongdae. 
					
					En la casa natal del Presidente Kim Il Sung, los visitantes volvieron a recordar su vida revolucionaria pasando revista a los objetos de interes historico exhibidos ahi. 
					
					Seguidamente, estuvieron en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios del Monte Taesong. 
					
					Colocaron ramos de flores ante el busto de la Heroina de Lucha Antijaponesa, Kim Jong Suk, y le rindieron el homenaje postumo. 
					
					En el Museo del Movimiento Juvenil, los participantes recordaron una vez mas las hazanas de los grandes Lideres quienes dieron inicio al movimiento juvenil coreano y abrieron la historia de construccion de potencia juvenil. 
					
					El proximo destino fue la Exposicion Estatal Permanente de Regalos donde esta reflejada la voluntad de todos los connacionales de enaltecer a los grandes Lideres Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il como Sol de la nacion. 
					
					En el Lugar de Interes Historico-Revolucionario de Phyongchon y el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, constataron de nuevo la grandeza de los Generales Insignes del Paektu quienes crearon la tradicion de victorias sucesivas en la confrontacion antiyanqui que perdura siglo tras siglo. 
					
					Realizaron un recorrido por el Pabellon Central de Educacion Clasista, acondicionado como base de educacion clasista antiimperialista y antiyanqui.

articles.title: Publicado informe de investigacion sobre la violacion de DDHH en 2016 en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Publicado informe de investigacion sobre la violacion de DDHH en 2016 en Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 23 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La Sociedad de Medidas de DDHH en el Sur de Corea de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publico el dia 23 el informe de investigacion sobre la violacion de DDHH en 2016 en el Sur de Corea para denunciar 10 de un sinnumero de los crimenes de ese tipo, cometidos por la horda traidora de Park Geun-hye en el ano en curso. 
					Ante todo, el documento revelo el abominable secuestro colectivo.
					
					El 5 de abril pasado, mas de 10 ciudadanas norcoreanas, quienes trabajaban en el extranjero, fueron raptadas y llevadas en contra de su voluntad al suelo surcoreano, recuerda el informe y prosigue:
					
					Para colmo, las autoridades titeres surcoreanas libraron una brutal "operacion de sumision" contra las secuestradas. 
					
					Por otra parte, las tentativas de despliegue de THAAD estan acabando con la cuna de vida del pueblo surcoreano.
					
					El THAAD, arma mortifera de guerra nuclear del imperio norteamericano, emite fuertes ondas electromagneticas y ruido ensordecedor del motor que hacen tremendo dano a la vida del ser humano y al ambiente ecologico. Por esta razon, hasta el circulo militar norteamericano lo evalua como "sistema con defectos fatales".
					
					Los crimenes anti-DDHH llevaron a la quiebra la vida poblacional.
					
					Este ano, debido a los actos corruptos y la impotencia de la camarilla de Park, la economia surcoreana cayo en el estado moribundo y la vida del pueblo llego al nivel deplorable.
					
					La "deuda estatal" llego a un billon 170 mil millones de US$, cifra record de la historia, y el numero de las grandes empresas surcoreanas a punto de bancarrota se incremento 37% en comparacion con el ano 2012. 
					
					Mas de 2 mil empresas pequenas y medianas, que se dedican a la produccion de mercancias exportables, se colapsaron en colectivo produciendo el efecto domino en la industria manufacturera en general donde ya se dieron a la quiebra mas de 90 mil entidades. 
					
					El numero de desempleados llego a mas de 4 millones 500 mil,  23. 3% mas en comparacion con 2013. 
					
					En el Sur de Corea hay nada menos que 10 millones de subempleados y la tasa de desempleados jovenes marco 34.2%, record de la historia. 
					
					La medida de la camarilla de Park que cerro brusca y totalmente la Zona Industrial de Kaesong violo flagrantemente el derecho a subsistencia de muchos empresarios y obreros.
					
					El asesinato del campesino Paek Nam Gi fue producto de la represion violenta y fascista.
					
					Se ha desatado el panico a la muerte en el Sur de Corea debido al incidente de esterilizante humidificador.
					
					Bajo el pretexto de exterminar las bacterias existentes en el aire de la habitacion, una empresa multinacional extranjera y los consorcios surcoreanos vendieron gran cantidad de esterilizantes que contienen sustancias quimicas toxicas.
					
					Desde enero hasta finales de agosto de este ano, el numero de victimas directas y muertos por el incidente se incremento a 3 mil 204 y 693, respectivamente. A esa cifra, se anaden las victimas potenciales que llegarian a 290 mil por lo menos y a 2 millones 270 mil al maximo. 
					
					El 12 de octubre pasado, el periodico surcoreano Hankook Ilbo dio a la publicidad que Chongwadae ha elaborado la "lista negra" de las figuras del circulo de literatura y arte y la remitio al Ministerio de Cultura, Deporte y Turismo y a los organos adscritos. 
					
					En esa lista estaban incluidos 9 mil 473 nombres de los literatos y artistas, quienes suscribieron la declaracion en demanda de la abolicion del "proyecto de ejecucion" del gobierno referente a la ley especial de la tragedia del ferry Sewol o apoyaron la declaracion sobre la situacion referente al mismo incidente, y de los otros que votaron a favor de los candidatos de la oposicion e independientes durante las pasadas elecciones presidenciales y las del alcalde de Seul.
					
					En suelo surcoreano se reportan sin parar los maltratos a la poblacion infantil y los actos violadores de DDHH en el ejercito titere. 
					
					Al hacer nulo el crimen de esclavitud sexual para el viejo ejercito japones, la banda traidora de Park hirio doblemente a las victimas y mancho la dignidad y orgullo nacionales.
					
					Este delito jamas tolerable es comparable con los crimenes cometidos por "5 traidores de Ulsa" que vendieron el pais a los agresores japoneses. 
					
					Al fabricar la abominable "ley de DDHH del Norte", cuya aprobacion habia sido suspendida en los anos anteriores, los partidarios de Park tratan de manchar la imagen de la RPDC.
					
					Pero, esa ley repugnante no da otro resultado que revelar los crimenes anti-DDHH de ellos mismos.
					
					El expediente criminal anti-DDHH de este ano de los titeres surcoreanos sera registrado en la historia como la verguenza mas grande.

articles.title: ACNC comenta acto cinico de Japon para eludir la liquidacion del pasado
articles.content:
ACNC comenta acto cinico de Japon para eludir la liquidacion del pasado
Pyongyang, 23 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Japon lanza la febril campana de derechos humanos anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea pretextando el "problema de secuestro".
					El dia 16, en la ciudad de Kurume del departamento de Fukuoka tuvo lugar bajo auspicios del gobierno y otros el "seminario de DDHH" con el tema de "rescatar a los secuestrados por el Norte de Corea".
					
					Tres dias despues, el director del Secretariado del Gabinete declaro que desde el ano proximo, el gobierno japones ampliara el numero de ondas cortas radiales para los japoneses "secuestrados por el Norte de Corea".
					
					Esto es un acto cinico de los reaccionarios japoneses para encubrir los casos de rapto que se reportan a menudo en la sociedad japonesa, ocultar el secuestro y arresto forzado cometidos por los imperialistas japoneses en el pasado en Corea y otros paises asiaticos y eludir la liquidacion del pasado pretextando el ya resuelto "problema de secuestro".
					
					En los ultimos anos, en el interior de Japon aparecen uno tras otro los desaparecidos que segun la insistencia de las autoridades japonesas, fueron secuestrados por el Norte de Corea.
					
					Solo en este ano, aparecieron varias personas y hace un mes, se ha buscado otro "desaparecido especifico secuestrado por el Norte de Corea".
					
					En junio pasado, la policia del departamento Fukui declaro que fue descubierto en el interior del pais Kazuya Mirauchi que tenia 32 anos cuando fue desaparecido, de quien insistian en que no se puede negar la posibilidad de haber sido "secuestrado" en 1997 por el Norte de Corea.
					
					El primero de diciembre, el departamento de seguridad publica de la Agencia de Policia de Tokio anuncio que "fue descubierto en la segunda quincena de noviembre en el interior del pais Masanori Kachuki de 68 anos de edad (36 anos de edad en el momento de desaparicion), esfumado en febrero de 1985 en Edogawa de la metropoli de Tokio de quien se decia que no se descartaba la posibilidad de haber sido secuestrado por el Norte de Corea.
					
					Japon es el cuartel general de secuestro que no tiene ni el elemental derecho a hablar de los DDHH.
					
					En el siglo pasado, arresto por la fuerza a mas de 8 millones 400 mil jovenes y adultos coreanos para imponerles los trabajos de esclavitud medieval y convertirles en carne de canon de las guerras de agresion. Asesino salvajemente a mas de un millon de coreanos y convirtio a 200 mil mujeres coreanas en esclavas sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones.
					
					Sin embargo, Japon se describe como "victima de secuestro" y dice sin vacilacion alguna que "no puede liquidar el pasado sin resolver el problema de secuestro".
					
					Ahora, prorroga cada ano las medidas de sancion anti-RPDC, iniciadas bajo el pretexto del "problema de secuestro", y elude pedir disculpas e indemnizar sus inauditos crimenes de lesa humanidad del pasado desoyendo la demanda de la sociedad internacional.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses arman escandalo con el "problema de secuestro" para enfocar a la RPDC la atencion mundial y ocultar sus crimenes de DDHH.
					
					La liquidacion del pasado es el problema que debe ser resuelto sin falta.
					
					Cuanto mas intente Japon negar sus crimenes del pasado y dejar en el olvido de la historia sus actos de agresion y saqueo, tanto mas conocera la sociedad internacional su fachada inmoral y descarada.
					
					Japon debe ver correctamente la corriente de la epoca y parar ahora mismo sus acciones mezquinas para eludir la liquidacion del pasado.
